question:
In triangle $ABC,$
\[\tan \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \tan \frac{A}{2} = \frac{1}{29} \quad \text{and} \quad \tan \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right) \tan \frac{B}{2} = \frac{1}{27}.\]Find $\tan \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \tan \frac{C}{2}.$
answer:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\tan \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \tan \frac{A}{2} &= \frac{\sin (\frac{B - C}{2}) \sin \frac{A}{2}}{\cos (\frac{B - C}{2}) \cos \frac{A}{2}} \\
&= \frac{\cos (\frac{A + C - B}{2}) - \cos (\frac{A + B - C}{2})}{\cos (\frac{A + B - C}{2}) + \cos (\frac{A + C - B}{2})} \\
&= \frac{\cos (90^\circ - B) - \cos (90^\circ - C)}{\cos (90^\circ - C) + \cos (90^\circ - B)} \\
&= \frac{\sin B - \sin C}{\sin C + \sin B}.
\end{align*}As usual, let $a = BC,$ $b = AC,$ and $c = AB.$  By the Law of Sines, $\frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C},$ so
\[\frac{\sin B - \sin C}{\sin C + \sin B} = \frac{b - c}{b + c} = \frac{1}{29}.\]Then $29b - 29c = b + c,$ so $28b = 30c,$ or $\frac{b}{15} = \frac{c}{14}.$

Similarly, we can show that
\[\tan \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right) \tan \frac{B}{2} = \frac{c - a}{c + a},\]so $\frac{c - a}{c + a} = \frac{1}{27}.$  Then $27c - 27a = c + a,$ so $26c = 28a,$ or $\frac{a}{13} = \frac{c}{14}.$

Finally,
\[\tan \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \tan \frac{C}{2} = \frac{a - b}{a + b} = \frac{13 - 15}{13 + 15} = \frac{-2}{28} = \boxed{-\frac{1}{14}}.\]
agents_response:
We can take advantage of the identity $\tan x = \frac{\sin x}{\cos x},$ for $x \neq \frac{k \pi}{2},$ where $k$ is an integer.  Thus, we can write the conditions of the problem as
\[\frac{\sin \frac{B - C}{2}}{\cos \frac{B - C}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{A}{2}}{\cos \frac{A}{2}} = \frac{1}{29} \quad \text{and} \quad \frac{\sin \frac{C - A}{2}}{\cos \frac{C - A}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{B}{2}}{\cos \frac{B}{2}} = \frac{1}{27}.\]Since $A + B + C = \pi,$ $C = \pi - A - B,$ so
\[\frac{A - C}{2} = \frac{A - (\pi - A - B)}{2} = \frac{2A + B - \pi}{2} = A + \frac{B - \pi}{2}\]and
\[\frac{B - C}{2} = \frac{B - (\pi - A - B)}{2} = \frac{2B + A - \pi}{2} = B + \frac{A - \pi}{2},\]so
\[\frac{\sin \frac{A - C}{2}}{\cos \frac{A - C}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{C}{2}}{\cos \frac{C}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{B - C}{2}}{\cos \frac{B - C}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{A}{2}}{\cos \frac{A}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{C - A}{2}}{\cos \frac{C - A}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{B}{2}}{\cos \frac{B}{2}} = \frac{1}{29} \cdot \frac{1}{27} = \frac{1}{783}.\]The left-hand side is equivalent to $\sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right),$ so
\[\sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right) = \frac{1}{783}.\]From the Law of Sines, $\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C},$ so
\[\frac{a}{2R} = \frac{b}{2R} = \frac{c}{2R},\]where $R$ is the circumradius of triangle $ABC.$  But from the Law of Cosines, $a^2 = b^2 + c^2 - 2bc \cos A,$ $b^2 = a^2 + c^2 - 2ac \cos B,$ and $c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2ab \cos C,$ so another expression for the area of triangle $ABC$ is
\[\frac{abc}{4R} = [ABC] = \frac12 ab \sin C = \frac12 bc \sin A = \frac12 ac \sin B,\]so $\sin A = \sin B = \sin C = \frac{2R}{c} = \frac{2R}{b} = \frac{2R}{a}.$  Then
\[\sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right) = \left[ \sin \left( \frac{A}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2 - \sin \left( \frac{A}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{B}{2} \right) - \sin \left( \frac{B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) - \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{A}{2} \right).\]Since we know that $\frac{\sin \frac{B - C}{2}}{\cos \frac{B - C}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{A}{2}}{\cos \frac{A}{2}} = \frac{1}{29}$ and $\frac{\sin \frac{C - A}{2}}{\cos \frac{C - A}{2}} \cdot \frac{\sin \frac{B}{2}}{\cos \frac{B}{2}} = \frac{1}{27},$ substituting these values in gives us
\[\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2 - \frac{1}{29} - \frac{1}{27} = \frac{1}{783},\]which simplifies to
\[\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2 = \frac{29 + 27 + 783}{783 \cdot 29 \cdot 27} = \frac{839}{629829},\]so $\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2 = \frac{839}{629829}.$

We want to find $\tan \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \tan \left( \frac{C}{2} \right),$ which by the same process as above is equal to $\frac{\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2}{\cos \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \cos \left( \frac{C}{2} \right)}.$  Using the Product-to-Sum Formulas, we can rewrite this as
\[\frac{\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2}{\frac12 \left[ \cos \left( \frac{A + B - 2C}{4} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{A + B + 2C}{4} \right) \right]}.\]Using the identity $\cos x = 1 - 2 \sin ^2 \left( \frac{x}{2} \right),$ this simplifies to
\[\frac{\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2}{\frac12 \left[ 1 - 2 \sin ^2 \left( \frac{A + B - 2C}{8} \right) + 1 - 2 \sin ^2 \left( \frac{A + B + 2C}{8} \right) \right]}.\]Substituting the values we know, this simplifies to
\[\frac{\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \sin \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) \right] ^2}{\frac12 \left[ 1 - 2 \left( \left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 \right) + 1 - 2 \left( \left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 \right) \right]}.\]Since we know that $\left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 = \left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right) \right] ^2 - \frac{1}{29} - \frac{1}{27},$ substituting this value in simplifies our desired expression to
\[\frac{\left[ \left[ \sin \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{B - C}{2} \right) \right] ^2 + \left[ \sin \left( \frac{C - A}{2} \right) \right] ^2 - \frac{1}{29} - \frac{1}{27} \right] ^2}{\frac12 \left[ 1 - 2 \left( \frac{839}{629829} \right) + 1 - 2 \left( \frac{839}{629829} \right) \right]}.\]Solving gives $\tan \left( \frac{A - B}{2} \right) \tan \left( \frac{C}{2} \right) = \boxed{\frac{1}{31}}.$
